intro: Torenia alboviolacea, commonly known as the white viola or white torenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas. The flowers bloom throughout the growing season, making it a popular choice for gardeners seeking ornamental plants.
